pullRequest.title: Generate cancellation message for currentState=null desiredState=DROPPED
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issues

 My PR addresses the following Helix issues and references them in the PR description:

Fixes #830
Description

 Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

To fix the issue that Helix fail to send cancel message when currentState=null and desiredState=DROPPED, this PR adds message generation logic to the condition before the "continue". To reduce the duplication of code, separate the related code section out and put into individual methods.
Condition: current state = null, desired state = dropped, there is pending message. Current state is checked, and since it is null, it is set to the initial state OFFLINE for further handling.
Before fix: all message generation logics are skipped for this instance, this handling is to fix a previous problem where under this condition, infinite "OFFLINE to DROPPED" state transition messages. And we are having the problem that because we skip the message generation logics, the cancellation message for the pending message won't be generated.
After fix: this fix separated the generation of cancellation message for pending message from other message generation logics to be a single method, and call this method when the above edge case is met.
Tests

 The following tests are written for this issue:

TestSendCancellationMessageFromOFFLINEToDROPPED

 My commits all reference appropriate Apache Helix GitHub issues in their subject lines. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "How to write a good git commit message":

Subject is limited to 50 characters (not including Jira issue reference)
